  • The Special Attack investment along with the Modest nature is necessary to pick up a OHKO on Landorus, Walking Wake, and Terastillized Urshifu-R with Meteor Beam. The OHKO on Landorus and Urshifu turns the match up against hyper offensive teams completely on its head, especially with speed control support from Tornadus.

  • The Defense investment is enough to guarantee surviving Rillaboom's Wood Hammer and a favourable roll of taking Kingambit's Iron Head. The Special Defensive investment lets it live Gholdengo's Make It Rain and Latias's Mist Ball. The rest of the EVs are invested into Speed, which allows Glimmora to outspeed Choice Scarf Landorus-T when in Tailwind.

  • Tera Grass has better synergy with Glimmora's original typing and provides an immunity to spore, but gives Glimmora weakness to common threats such as Chien-Pao. Tera Water, defensively, is a stronger neutral type into the metagame, but has fewer relevant resistances to common threats.

Bulky Attacker.description:
• Both Earth Power and Energy Ball are fine options, but Energy Ball can do more damage against neutral targets if Glimmora Terastallizes into a Grass type.

  • Mortal Spin is used as the final move for a more consistent method to spread poison than Toxic Debris.

  • The Assault Vest gives Glimmora much more longevity, as it allows it to comfortably tank special attacks while still dissuading physical attackers with the threat of Toxic Spikes. On teams where being able to spread poison is important, Assault Vest is a good option.

  • The special bulk allows Glimmora to live many strong super effective attacks, such as Choice Specs Gholdengo's Make It Rain; it also makes Choice Specs Flutter Mane's Shadow Ball a 3HKO. Glimmora still lives a Rillaboom Wood Hammer with the HP investment.

Dondozo.overview:
• Dondozo is a formidable threat thanks to its stats being doubled when combined with Tatsugiri's Commander ability. Due to its immense bulk, Dondozo is difficult to remove without adequate answers, easily sweeping through entire teams on its own.

  • Dondozo performs best with offensive threats that can break apart teams for it and still function independently without needing to pivot. Examples include Chien-Pao and Dragonite, as well as Tornadus and a sweeper such as Urshifu-S or Flutter Mane. The two cores utilize strong speed control and get off massive damage early, allowing Dondozo to clean up. Glimmora is another excellent partner, as its ability and signature move put foes on a timer, forcing them to burn through Dondozo before fainting to Toxic poison.

  • Dondozo struggles against Pokemon that can ignore its stat boosts, either by neutralizing or bypassing it entirely. Both Urshifu formes and Chien-Pao with Sacred Sword ignore Dondozo's Defense boost, with Chien-Pao both outspeeding and threatening Dondozo if it uses Tera Grass, and Urshifu-S dealing big damage with Wicked Blow and removing Dondozo's ability to stall with Protect. Incineroar and Gouging Fire are able to consistently weaken Dondozo with Breaking Swipe and Intimidate cycling respectively. A combination of Incineroar and Amoonguss is particularly difficult to handle, as Amoonguss can keep Incineroar safe with redirection and Incineroar is free to cycle Parting Shot and Intimidate.

  • Dondozo requires much more experience to properly play compared to other sweepers, due to only making plays with one Pokemon for most of the game. While its not impossible to play into certain difficult matchups, especially with a strong composition and much practice, it necessitates significant reads and good positioning of Dondozo to win.

Offensive Sweeper.description:
• Wave Crash is Dondozo's strongest Water-type move, OHKOing Pokemon like Tornadus and Gholdengo. Earthquake bypasses Follow Me from Ogerpon-W, and provides it a strong spread move thats picks off weakened foes.

  • Rocky Helmet breaks Focus Sash on Chien-Pao and Urshifu, allowing for an OHKO. It also allows for big damage on Urshifu-R using Surging Strikes. Leftovers allows Dondozo to recover swathes of health, even more so by stalling with Protect. However, its harder to use now, as most threats to Dondozo can outdamage Leftovers recovery, especially so considering the Urshifu formes ignore Protect. Clear Amulet can be used to remove ways to weaken Dondozo, primarily Incineroar and Gouging Fire.

  • 20 Defense EVs ensure that Sacred Sword from Chien-Pao is a 4HKO and allow Dondozo to survive two Wicked Blows from Urshifu-S. 76 Special Defense EVs allow Dondozo to survive two Moonblasts from Tera Fairy Choice Specs Flutter Mane. The Attack investment ensures Wave Crash OHKOes Urshifu-S after Rocky Helmet damage and that Order Up 2HKOes Ogerpon-W and Urshifu-R.

  • Tera Grass provides resistances to Grass- and Electric-type attacks, as well as giving an immunity to Spore from Amoonguss, which is otherwise difficult to deal with.

Supportive Yawn.description:
• Dondozo can utilize its strong natural bulk and typing to function as a supportive wall with Yawn.

  • Yawn Dondozo pairs best with Ting-Lu, as a combination of Sand Tomb and Yawn can reliably slow down foes and Ting-Lu's Vessel of Ruin helps with Dondozo's frailer Special Defense.

  • Dondozo struggles against Rillaboom and Amoonguss, as both resist Wave Crash, and it is harder to make damage over time stick with Grassy Terrain and Pollen Puff respectively. Additionally, the former threatens super effective damage on Dondozo and the latter threatens Spore.

  • Leftovers recovery gives Dondozo additional staying power in slower-paced battles compared to recovery Berries.

  • Oblivious prevents Dondozo from being shut down with Taunt from Pokmon such as Tornadus or affected by Intimidate from foes like Incineroar.

  • The invested bulk allows Dondozo to survive Thunderbolt from Raging Bolt, as well as surviving two Earth Powers from Landorus and OHKOing in return with Wave Crash. Heavy Slam is used to OHKO Flutter Mane.

Tatsugiri.overview: • Tatsugiri is solely used to combine with Dondozo, and shouldn't be picked outside of that purpose.

Choice Scarf Support.description:
• Icy Wind is used as a late-game speed control option. Dragon Pulse is a more consistent STAB move compared to Draco Meteor and Muddy Water, at the cost of damage. Sleep Talk allows Tatsugiri to better answer Amoonguss, while Tera Blast hits Flutter Mane and Chien-Pao in the rare circumstances where Tatsugiri is Terastallized.

  • Choice Scarf allows Tatsugiri to clean up late-game once Dondozo is down, either serving as speed control with Icy Wind to support its partner or dealing damage with Muddy Water and Draco Meteor.

  • The given EVs allow Tatsugiri to outspeed Choice Scarf Landorus-T and survive an Icicle Crash from Chien-Pao and a Wicked Blow from Urshifu-S.

  • Tera Steel gives Tatsugiri a resistance to Steel and Fairy and a generally better defensive profile. Tera Water can be used to boost Muddy Water's damage and remove its weakness to Flutter Mane's Fairy-type STAB moves, which is useful in some end-game scenarios.

Farigiraf.overview:
• Farigiraf's excellent bulk combined with the immunity to Prankster Taunt and Fake Out given by Armor Tail ability make Farigiraf an extremely consistent Trick Room setter. This is because its ability prevents Farigiraf from being taunted by the main Taunt user in the format, Tornadus, and the opponent can no longer use Fake Out to stall out Trick Room turns. Additionally, Armor Tail gives Farigiraf a great matchup against Pokemon that rely on priority like Rillaboom and Dragonite.

  • The different Ogerpon formes are all great partners for Farigiraf, because the redirection means Trick Room is almost guaranteed to go up, while their Grass typing means that Spore is no longer an issue. Ogerpon-W has a great defensive typing and can easily tank most hits it redirects away from Farigiraf, Ogerpon-H hits Amoonguss and the Steel-types that resist Farigiraf's moves, and Ogerpon-C is particularly helpful for redirection due to its Sturdy ability. Rillaboom and Incineroar are also great partners, as Fake Out + Trick Room is a great combination due to the fact that Fake Out prevents both opponents from attacking Farigiraf before Trick Room goes up.

  • Partners that are physically frail or weak to one of the big priority moves like Urshifu-R really enjoy having it as an ally. Flutter Mane is an excellent partner, as it can handily deal with the Dark-types that Farigiraf struggles against, and Ursaluna-B is a strong Trick Room sweeper that enjoys being immune to the Fake Out cycling from Incineroar and Rillaboom.

  • Farigiraf can have a difficult time against Pokemon that can threaten to OHKO it both in and out of Terastallization, like Kingambit and Urshifu-S. Another issue is opposing Trick Room Pokemon, especially Torkoal and Amoonguss, the former being able to outspeed Farigiraf inside of Trick Room and OHKO it with Tera Fire-sun-boosted Eruptions, and the latter being able to put any Farigiraf that isn't running Safety Goggles to sleep and just being a general threat when Trick Room is up.

Bulky Support.description:
• While Psychic and Trick Room are self-explanatory, Dazzling Gleam is a fantastic option to hit Dark-types. Psychic Noise is a good option, as it completely restricts the use of Horn Leech from the Ogerpon formes, and Drain Punch from Iron Hands, which Farigiraf's partners might be weak to; Psychic Noise also stops all Pokemon from healing from Rillaboom's Grassy Terrain. Imprison is used to block opposing Trick Room while also stopping opposing Flutter Mane from using Dazzling Gleam. Protect is just a generally consistent option, allowing Farigiraf to stick around to provide the team with priority blocking for longer.

  • Sitrus Berry is generally preferred, as the extra recovery allows it to live important attack combos such as Chien-Pao's Icicle Crash into Entei's Sacred Fire; however, Safety Goggles is also a valid option, allowing it to ignore Spore from opposing Amoonguss, a common counter to Trick Room.

  • With Sitrus Berry recovery, Farigiraf can always survive an Icicle Crash from Adamant Chien-Pao and a Sword of Ruin-boosted Sacred Fire from Entei. The Special Defense investment allows Farigiraf to live an unboosted Overheat from Timid Chi-Yu. The rest of the EVs were put into offense.

  • Fairy is the best Tera type on Farigiraf in this format, allowing it to resist common Dark-type attacks from Urshifu-S and Kingambit. It also allows Farigiraf to deal more substantial chip damage with Tera Fairy Dazzling Gleam, allowing it to OHKO Urshifu-S.

Offensive.description:
• Hyper Voice activates Throat Spray to inflict a lot of damage and boost subsequent Psychics. Psyshock deals less damage than Psychic overall, but it allows Farigiraf to hit Flutter Mane and Assault Vest Pokemon like Rillaboom harder.

  • Throat Spray allows Farigiraf to put really good amounts of pressure unlike other Trick Room setters. Life Orb allows for more immediate damage and more pivoting ability, as you wont lose the damage boost when switching out, but provides less damage overall.

  • The HP and Special Defense EVs allow Farigiraf to survive Tera Fairy Moonblast from Choice Specs Flutter Mane, Tera Normal Helping Hand-boosted Hyper Voice from Life Orb Ursaluna-B, as well as non-Tera Life Orb Blood Moon. The heavy amount of Special Attack investment allows Farigiraf to serve its role as an offensive Pokemon very well, especially after a Throat Spray boost. The Defense investment allows Farigiraf to take Surging Strikes from Tera Water Choice Scarf Urshifu-R.

Kingambit.overview:
• Kingambit's strong stat line, good typing, and Defiant allow it to shine as an Intimidate counter and general offensive threat. It can function at any Speed tier thanks to Sucker Punch making up for its low Speed. It is flexible against many match ups thanks to its huge bulk and ability to exert huge amounts of pressure after a Swords Dance.

  • Gouging Fire is a fantastic partner for Kingambit, as it can boost its attack with Howl and keep it up on the field longer by reducing opponent's Attack with Breaking Swipe, with Kingambit shielding it from intimidate in return. Physical attackers such as Rillaboom, Ogerpon-W, and Chien-Pao all appreciate Kingambit warding off Intimidate users, with the former two providing Fake Out and Follow Me support, respectively, helping Kingambit set up a Swords Dance, and the latter boosting its damage with Sword of Ruin.

  • Since Kingambit usually only runs Dark-type attacks, it struggles against Pokemon that resist it, such as the Urshifu formes and Incineroar, the latter of which matches up well against Kingambit even when boosting its Attack thanks to resisting both of its STAB types. It also has problems with Amoonguss, since it can redirect Sucker Punch with rage powder and put it to sleep quite easily, while Kingambit cannot threaten it much in return. Raging Bolt can outspeed it and use Thunderclap to attack before Sucker Punch while taking Kowtow Cleave very well, especially since most sets run Tera Fairy.

Offensive.description:
• Swords Dance significantly raises the pressure Kingambit exerts, allowing it to deal significant damage even against resisted targets. However, Iron Head can be used to cover for Fairy-types such as Flutter Mane.

  • Black Glasses provides extra damage, allowing for an OHKO on Flutter Mane at +1 with Sucker Punch; Safety Goggles, however, gives Kingambit a better match-up against Amoonguss.

  • Tera Dragon is chosen to grant resistances to the Ogerpon formes' STAB attacks and other metagame threats that resist Dark, such as Urshifu-R and Chi-Yu. Tera Fairy is also a strong option as a neutral typing, and it also allows Kingambit to wall Urshifu-S and other Fighting-types.

Bulky Attacker.description:
• The given EV spread allows Kingambit to survive Life Orb Ursaluna-B's Earth Power or an Ivy Cudgel from Ogerpon-H as well as avoid the 3HKO from Raging Bolt's Thunderbolt. The Speed investment allows Kingambit to outspeed Landorus in tailwind.

  • Low Kick allows Kingambit to threaten Dark-Types such as Incineroar and opposing Kingambit; however, Tera Blast can also be used to cover for Dark- and Fighting-Types at the cost of needing to Terastallize.

Scream Tail.overview:
• Scream Tail has strong supportive moves such as Encore and Disable, which it can consistently use to disrupt opposing Pokemon thanks to its great natural bulk and Speed.

  • Scream Tail works well alongside Pokemon such as Gholdengo and Ogerpon-W, as it can punish passive plays and shut down Choice-locked threats such as opposing Flutter Mane and Urshifu-R, locking them into resisted Fairy- and Water-type attacks for Gholdengo and Ogerpon-W, respectively.

  • Scream Tail cannot provide any offensive pressure outside Dazzling Gleam and hence is completely reliant on its partners to deal damage. It is also vulnerable to being shut down by moves such as Taunt from Tornadus and Spore from Amoonguss. Scream Tail struggles against Gholdengo, which completely counters Scream Tail by being immune to status moves thanks to Good as Gold.

Support.description:
• Booster Energy allows Scream Tail to outspeed most of the metagame and launch fast Encores and Disables.

  • Dazzling Gleam is used to chip low health targets. Disable and Encore are great supportive tools to disrupt foes and can punish passive play.

  • The EV spread allows it to survive Choice Specs Flutter Mane Shadow Ball while comfortably taking a Tera Water Surging Strikes from Urshifu-R and Tera Dark Wicked Blow from Urshifu-S.

  • Tera Dark is preferred for Prankster Taunt immunity and a Ghost resistance. Alternatively, Tera Grass can be used to provide immunity to powder moves from Amoonguss.

Flutter Mane.overview:
• Flutter Mane's extraordinary Special Attack and Speed combined with its fantastic offensive typing makes it one of the most effective cleaners in the format, 2HKOing the majority of the metagame. Flutter Mane can also play a supportive role for its team thanks to Icy Wind and Speed Booster Energy.

  • Offensive sets appreciate Pokemon that bring speed control like Latias and Tornadus, as well as Pokemon that provide it with longevity like Incineroar and Amoonguss. Supportive sets instead become the speed control and help support slower offensive Pokemon like Urshifu-R and Chi-Yu. Chi-Yu works particularly well as a partner, bolstering Flutter Mane's damage with Beads of Ruin and checking Steel-types like Kingambit while Flutter Mane takes care of Fighting-types like Urshifu-R in return.

  • Bulky Assault Vest users that can take a boosted Moonblast and OHKO Flutter Mane in response like Kingambit and Rillaboom are some of its toughest matchups. Flutter Mane also faces issues into faster threats like Chien-Pao and Choice Scarf Urshifu-R. Additionally, redirectors like Indeedee-F and Ogerpon-W mitigate its damage output when on the field.

Offensive.description:
• Flutter Mane is an effective cleaner thanks to Moonblast, which is its strongest STAB move, and Dazzling Gleam, which provides spread damage.

  • Special Attack Booster Energy is Flutter Mane's strongest boosting item if it wants to keep Protect. Fairy Feather can be used instead, allowing it to retain its offensive boosts when switching at the cost of damage.

  • The EV spread is built to survive an Ice Spinner from Jolly Chien-Pao and to outspeed Tornadus, with the remaining EVs boosting Flutter Mane's Special Attack

  • Flutter Mane appreciates Tera Fairy to further boost its damage on Moonblast and Dazzling Gleam . This also removes its Ghost weakness and makes it resist Dark-type attacks, allowing it to better deal with opposing Flutter Mane and survive a potential Sucker Punch from Pokemon like Kingambit.

Choice Specs.description:
• Choice Specs is Flutter Mane's strongest boosting item and allows it to do immediate damage.

  • Flutter Mane utilizes Icy Wind as a speed control option and as coverage to threaten chipped Landorus. Thunderbolt and Power Gem are strong coverage options for important Pokemon like Tera Water Urshifu-R and Incineroar, respectively.

  • The above spread allows Flutter Mane to survive a Surging Strikes from a Choice Scarf Urshifu-R while outspeeding Adamant Chien-Pao. The remaining EVs are used to maximise its Special Attack.

  • Flutter Mane takes advantage of Tera Fairy by removing its Ghost weakness and giving it a Dark resistance, allowing it to better deal with opposing Flutter Mane and survive a potential Sucker Punch from Pokemon like Chien-Pao. Tera Fairy also allows Flutter Mane to secure an OHKO on Tera Water Urshifu-R.

Speed-Boosting Support.description:
• Flutter Mane requires Icy Wind to accomplish its role as speed control, forcing it to pick between Dazzling Gleam and Moonblast.

  • Speed Booster Energy allows Flutter Mane to outspeed the majority of the metagame.

  • With Booster Energy, Flutter Mane can outspeed opposing Chien-Pao at -1 and Modest Gholdengo in Tailwind. The defensive investment lets it survive Adamant Chien-Pao's Ice Spinner and Gholdengo's Make It Rain.

  • Tera Fairy is appreciated to gain more of an offensive presence and helps against opposing Flutter Mane, as Speed Booster Energy Flutter Mane is unable to OHKO opposing Flutter Mane with Shadow Ball.

Iron Bundle.overview:
• Iron bundle is the fastest threat in Regulation F thanks to Booster Energy and is used as a speed control option. It can threaten Landorus, Ogerpon-W, Incineroar, and Urshifu-R with super effective damage and an OHKO on the former two.

  • Iron Bundle appreciates offensive Pokemon that take advantage of Icy Wind like Urshifu-S, Ogerpon-H, Choice Specs Flutter Mane, and Landorus. Flutter Mane and Landorus specifically threaten Kingambit and Urshifu for Iron Bundle.

  • Iron Bundle is weak to priority attackers like Rillaboom, Chien-Pao, Dragonite, and Raging Bolt, since they can ignore Iron Bundle's Speed and Icy Wind's Speed drops while still pressuring it for huge damage if not an OHKO because of its low defenses.

Glass Cannon.description:
• Icy Wind is used for speed control, Hydro Pump is used as the main Water-STAB move, and Freeze-Dry is preferred to threaten common Water-types like Urshifu-R and Ogerpon-W.

  • Booster Energy is used to raise its Speed, which allows it to outspeed threats like Choice Scarf Urshifu-R, Booster Energy Flutter Mane, and Regidrago and Modest Landorus under Tailwind.

  • Tera Ghost is used for an immunity to threatening priority moves like Fake Out and Extreme Speed.

Iron Hands.overview:
• With great physical bulk and Attack, plus Assault Vest to shore up its special bulk, Iron Hands can stick on the field for a long time and deal plenty of damage, allowing it to serve as a bulky pivot. Fake Out also provides Iron Hands with utility.

  • Thanks to Iron Hands's bulk and power, it is able to take on a variety of Pokemon. Notable good matchups include both Urshifu formes, Kingambit, Tornadus and Raging Bolt.

  • Landorus and Landorus-T are extremely bad matchups for Iron Hands not running Ice Punch, and Landorus-T also has Intimidate to lower its damage output. Other notable bad matchups include Amoonguss and Latias, which can wall Iron Hands's STAB moves and punish it with Rocky Helmet, as well as Rillaboom, which can consistently beat it with Wood Hammer.

  • Despite Incineroar being weak to Iron Hands, thanks to Intimidate, Incineroar's higher Speed that lets it use Fake Out first, and Parting Shot, Incineroar can easily halve the damage output of Iron Hands.

  • Iron Hands fits best on balance teams, where it contributes to the pivot-heavy playstyle. Tailwind teams can also utilize Iron Hands as a defensive backbone and bulky pivot.

Bulky Attacker.description:
• Wild Charge is better than Thunder Punch, as the power allows for a lot of extra OHKOs to be taken, such as one on Urshifu-R.

  • Drain Punch is preferable for longevity, and while Close Combat can hit certain Pokemon like Incineroar harder, Iron Hands is meant to stick on the field, so a drop in both defenses as a side effect of using its Fighting-type STAB move goes against Iron Hands's best traits.

  • Ice Punch fixes the matchup vs both Landorus formes, Heavy Slam turns the tables on Flutter Mane, and Volt Switch is an option to turn Iron Hands into a pivot and provide it with a way to reset Attack drops from Intimidate.

  • Assault Vest maximizes Iron Hands's low special bulk.

  • An Adamant nature and Attack EVs take advantage of Iron Hands' massive Attack stat. Maximum Special Defense investment takes full advantage of Assault Vest. The Speed EVs outspeeds Urshifu-R under Tailwind and some slower Incineroar.

  • Using Tera defensively allows Iron Hands to avoid weaknesses like Fairy and Ground. Tera Grass allows it to ignore Amoonguss's Rage Powder and Spore, as well as providing it with a resistance to the STAB moves of Landorus and Urshifu-R. Tera Water allows Iron Hands to resist Urshifu-R's Surging Strikes, as well as not adding a weakness to Ice- and Flying-types for Urshifu-R's common partners like Tornadus and Chien-Pao to take advantage of. Tera Fairy is an overall good defensive type, as it is neutral into most of the metagame, but it's especially good for beating opposing Iron Hands and performing better into Raging Bolt.

Iron Jugulis.overview:
• Iron Jugulis's great type combination and access to strong support moves such as Tailwind and Snarl make it a niche but powerful disruptive threat. With Booster Energy, Iron Jugulis is able to outspeed almost every other Pokemon in the format and use its great support options to apply pressure on the opponent with fast Snarls and Air Slashes. Its typing gives it an immunity to Prankster Taunt, as well as resistances to attacks from several common threats such as Rillaboom's Wood Hammer and Urshifu-S's Wicked Blow.

  • Iron Jugulis is used on semi-Trick Room teams with Farigiraf and Ursaluna-B, as it forces opponents to respect both a potential Tailwind from Iron Jugulis and Trick Room from Farigiraf. Both Incineroar and Ogerpon-W are great partners for Iron Jugulis; Incineroar provides Fake Out support and weakens potential threats such as Chien-Pao with Intimidate, and Ogerpon-W provides redirection to allow Iron Jugulis to set up Tailwind more easily. Flutter Mane also forms a very strong and consistent pairing with Iron Jugulis, countering opposing Dark-types that Iron Jugulis would have trouble dealing with.

  • While having a few strong resistances, Iron Jugulis's typing also means it's weak to common metagame threats such as Flutter Mane, especially the Speed Booster Energy variants, and Chien-Pao, which threaten an OHKO. Iron Jugulis also struggles against Pokemon that resist its STAB moves and can take advantage of its low damage output like Incineroar and Raging Bolt. Additionally, Iron Jugulis struggles to find a place on most teams due to it competing with Tornadus, which, unlike Iron Jugulis, has access to Prankster Tailwind, a strong Flying-type STAB move in the form of Bleakwind Storm, and Prankster Rain Dance and Sunny Day.

Tailwind Support.description:
• Snarl is helpful to slow down the plethora of strong special attackers in the format.

  • Booster Energy allows Iron Jugulis to fire off fast attacks like Snarl into opposing special attackers and set up Tailwind more easily, as well as outspeed threats such as Chien-Pao.

  • The bulk allows Iron Jugulis to survive a Extreme Speed from Choice Band Tera Normal Dragonite with Sword of Ruin active, as well as an Icicle Crash from a -1 Attack Chien-Pao. After a Snarl, Iron Jugulis lives a Dazzling Gleam from Choice Specs Tera Fairy Flutter Mane, as well as Thunderbolt from Raging Bolt.

  • Both Tera Poison and Steel are viable, but Poison is generally preferred thanks to the Fighting resistance and generally better synergy with Iron Jugulis's original type. In comparison, Tera Steel gives more resistances to powerful moves in the format like Blood Moon and Make It Rain, but it is weak to more types than Tera Poison.

Baxcalibur.overview:
• Baxcalibur's massive Attack stat, solid bulk, and STAB Ice-type moves allow it to apply immediate offensive pressure or set up to sweep. Landorus, Raging Bolt, Rillaboom, and Amoonguss fear its Ice-type STAB moves, and Incineroar and Ogerpon-W struggle to damage Baxcalibur, which opens up setup opportunities.

  • Incineroar, Rillaboom, Ogerpon-W, and Amoonguss are great teammates for Baxcalibur, providing Intimidate, Fake Out, Grassy Terrain, and redirection support to give it opportunities to set up Swords Dance and fire off its attacks. Baxcalibur also functions well on Pelipper + Archaludon rain teams, as it threatens Raging Bolt, Amoonguss, Landorus, and Rillaboom, all of which rain struggles against.

  • Steel-types like Kingambit and Gholdengo resist Baxcalibur's STAB attacks, which can hinder its ability to sweep or punch holes. In addition, the prevalence of Flutter Mane, Urshifu-R, and Urshifu-S can pressure it to Terastallize. Baxcalibur's low Speed can also make it struggle to keep up with offensive pressure from the opposing side.

Clear Amulet.description:
• With the given EV spread, Baxcalibur can outspeed -1 Landorus and survive Choice Band Wicked Blow from Urshifu-S, a Tera Stellar Sacred Sword from Chien-Pao, and a Dazzling Gleam from Choice Specs Flutter Mane.

  • Glaive Rush is Baxcalibur's best Dragon-type STAB because of its massive Base Power, with Protect offsetting the drawback. Ice Shard makes up for Baxcalibur's middling Speed tier and threatens Landorus. Icicle Crash is a good Ice-type STAB that has a chance to flinch the target. Swords Dance grants Baxcalibur a boosting move that makes it a more threatening Pokemon to the opposition.

  • Tera Poison grants Baxcalibur a to resistance Urshifu's Close Combat and Flutter Mane's Fairy-type moves while also being a great neutral type against the majority of the metagame.

  • Clear Amulet gives Baxcalibur an immunity to Intimidate from the likes of Incineroar and Hisuian-Arcanine. It also helps against Icy Wind from Flutter Mane and ElectroWeb from Assault Vest Raging Bolt.

  • Thermal Exchange prevents Baxcalibur from being burned by Wil-O-Wisp users like Incineroar in addition to deterring Ogerpon-H and Chi-Yu from using their Fire-type STAB moves.

Gholdengo.overview:
• Gholdengo has solid stats all around, most notably a high Special Attack stat, as well as an amazing typing. This means it can be used as a setup sweeper with Nasty Plot. A well-positioned Gholdengo can beat Flutter Mane, Latias, Tornadus, and Iron Crown.

  • Gholdengo appreciates Pokemon that help it set up, so good partners are redirectors like Amoonguss and Ogerpon, Fake Out users like Rillaboom and Incineroar, and Pokemon with Intimidate like Landorus-T and Incineroar, which all create free turns and increase Gholdengo's longevity.

  • Tornadus is a great partner for Gholdengo, providing speed control to better answer faster threats like Flutter Mane. Urshifu-R and Landorus are also pair well with it, since they can threaten Pokemn that resist Make It Rain like Incineroar.

  • Gholdengo loves to Terastalize to deal with common threats like Landorus, Incineroar, Flutter Mane, and Chien-Pao which all threaten to OHKO it otherwise. This gives Gholdengo free turns to set up Nasty Plot.

Nasty Plot.description:
• Make It Rain is used for powerful STAB damage, and Shadow Ball is used as Gholdengo's Ghost-type STAB move.

  • The main item used is Leftovers so Gholdengo can stay on the field for longer. Gholdengo can also opt for Metal Coat to OHKO Flutter Mane, in sacrifice of longevity.

  • The bulk investment allows Gholdengo to almost always survive a Mystic Water Tera Water-boosted Surging Strikes from Urshifu-R and two Magnet-boosted Thunderclaps from Raging Bolt.

  • Gholdengo prefers Tera Fairy, but occasionally runs either Tera Steel or Dragon. Fairy allows Gholdengo to resist Urshifu-S's STAB moves and is a great defensive typing, bolstered by Gholdengo's original resistances to Steel and Poison. Tera Dragon also has great synergy with Gholdengo's Steel typing, providing welcome resistances to Ogerpon-W's STAB attacks. Tera Steel greatly increases Gholdengo's damage output and OHKOes Flutter Mane and the majority of Terastallized Pokemon, such as Tera Fairy Raging Bolt, Kingambit, and Gouging Fire.

Chien-Pao.overview:
• Chien-Pao is an excellent offensive Pokemon bearing a great offensive typing and a fantastic Speed tier. Chien-Pao is capable of taking on the majority of the format, and it's especially strong against Tornadus and Landorus thanks to its typing and Sword of Ruin.

  • Incineroar has Intimidate and resists both of Chien-Pao's STAB attacks, which makes it difficult for Chien-Pao to deal with, therefore Urshifu-R is a strong partner as it utilizes Sword of Ruin and pressures Incineroar.

  • Chien-Pao struggles to take on Urshifu-R, which can both take its attacks comfortably and outspeed it with a Choice Scarf. Urshifu-R can also threaten Chien-Pao through its Focus Sash. Terastallized Ogerpon-W and Amoonguss resist its Ice STAB moves and can redirect Sucker Punch, making them good answers to Chien-Pao.

Glass Cannon.description:
• Ice Spinner is an alternative Ice-type STAB move that provides increased accuracy and a way for teams to handle Rillaboom and Indeedee-F in exchange for higher power and a flinch chance. However, it prevents Chien-Pao from attacking Rocky Helmet Amoonguss and Latias as freely.

  • Chien-Pao uses Sacred Sword as coverage for relevant Pokemon such as Incineroar and Kingambit.

  • Chien-Pao utilizes Focus Sash to make up for its poor defensive typing combined with its lackluster bulk, as it allows it to stay an extra turn on the field to help partners exploit Sword of Ruin, which is significant for offensive compositions.

  • With Tera Stellar, Chien-Pao has the option to pick up OHKOs on Pokemon it usually wouldn't be able to OHKO, such as Flutter Mane and Amoonguss. However, it has to be wary of pivots and foes using Protect, as the power boost is temporary. Chien-Pao can also use Tera Ghost to remove its Fighting weakness and become immune to priority moves like Fake Out, which is crucial for Focus Sash.

Ting-Lu.overview:
• Ting-Lu is an offensive threat with incredibly high defensive stats and massive HP. Thanks to Vessel of Ruin, it can slow down the metagame's special attacking compositions, like Farigiraf + Ursaluna-B and Indeedee + Iron Crown.

  • Ting-Lu synergizes well with Kommo-o, as the combination of Vessel of Ruin and Iron Defense makes Kommo-o difficult to remove and allows for a sweep. Ting-Lu appreciates Trick Room from Porygon2, while Porygon2 benefits from the added bulk from Ting-Lu's ability Vessel of Ruin.

  • Due to its poor typing, Ting-Lu generally struggles against physical attackers that threaten it for super effective damage like the Urshifu formes, Ogerpon-W, and Rillaboom. It relies on teammates like Incineroar and Amoonguss to slow these threats down with Intimidate and redirection support.

Bulky Attacker.description:
• Heavy Slam allows it to OHKO Flutter Mane. Ruination consistently chips foes when they resist Stomping Tantrum or if Ting-Lu is Intimidated, making it a premier move for Ting-Lu, as it stays on the field for a long time. Snarl slows down special attackers, which, in combination with Vessel of Ruin, allows Ting-Lu to shut down almost every special attacker.

  • Ting-Lu uses Assault Vest to bolster its special bulk in combination with its ability, Vessel of Ruin.

  • The EV spread allows Ting-Lu to survive Tera Fairy Choice Specs Flutter Mane Moonblast and avoid getting 2HKOed by Tera Fairy Choice Specs Dazzling Gleam from Flutter Mane. It also allows it to almost always take Tera Water 156 EV Adamant Surging Strikes from Urshifu-R and comfortably survive Tera Water Ivy Cudgel from Ogerpon-W. The Attack investment ensures an OHKO on Flutter Mane with Heavy Slam when not Intimidated and a 2HKO on Incineroar and Raging Bolt with Stomping Tantrum.

  • Tera Poison is the most consistent Tera type for Ting-Lu, as it provides a resistance to Flutter Mane's Moonblast, the STAB moves of Rillaboom, and Close Combat from the Urshifu formes. It also becomes neutral to Water-type attacks from Urshifu-R and Ogerpon-W.

Chi-Yu.overview:
• With an excellent Special Attack stat, which is bolstered by Beads of Ruin and great STAB moves, Chi-Yu threatens its foes with the highest damage output in the format and Chi-Yu is capable of OHKOing the majority of the metagame. Beads of Ruin also helps increase Chi-Yu's partner's offensive pressure.

  • Chi-Yu struggles due to its mediocre Speed stat, so speed control from Tornadus and Speed Booster Energy Flutter Mane is greatly appreciated. Choice Scarf Chi-Yu prefers teaming up with offensive threats like Choice Specs Flutter Mane to make up for the lost damage output. Tornadus and Flutter Mane can also help take care of the Urshifu formes, which threaten Chi-Yu, while Chi-Yu can in return increase their damage output with Beads of Ruin as well as remove Steel-types like Kingambit.

  • Chi-Yu struggles against Pokemon that can take its attacks and either hinder it or exploit its weak defensive profile. Incineroar and Raging Bolt are great answers to Chi-Yu, as they can comfortably take all of its attacks and disrupt it through tools such as Fake Out, Knock Off, Parting Shot, Electroweb, and Snarl. Once Terastallized, Ogerpon-W also takes Chi-Yu's attacks incredibly well and threatens an OHKO on it with Ivy Cudgel.

Choice Attacker.description:
• Snarl is used as utility and a way to check special attacking compositions such as Farigiraf + Ursaluna-B. Overheat is appreciated as a single target nuke, hitting almost twice as hard as Heat Wave.

  • Choice Specs is used to give Chi-Yu maximum offensive pressure and allow it to pick up OHKOes on Amoonguss and Kingambit with Heat Wave. Alternatively, Chi-Yu can opt for Choice Scarf to outspeed threats like Landorus, Chien-Pao, and Flutter Mane.

  • The HP EVs allow for Chi-Yu to avoid the 2HKO from Flutter Mane's Moonblast and once Terastallized into the Ghost-type, almost always survive -1 Adamant Chien-Pao's Sucker Punch. The Speed EVs allow Chi-Yu to outspeed the Adamant Urshifu formes.

  • Chi-Yu prefers Tera Ghost to remove its Fighting weakness and be immune to common priority moves like Fake Out and Extreme Speed, which is crucial to preserve momentum. Although Chi-Yu can utilize Tera Fire to significantly increase its damage output, allowing Choice Scarf Chi-Yu to OHKO Ogerpon-W and Flutter Mane with Overheat and Choice Specs variants to remove Assault Vest Kingambit and Rillaboom with Heat Wave.

Roaring Moon.overview:
• Roaring Moon provides a niche as either a fast speed control option or setup sweeper thanks to the Prankster immunity provided by its Dark typing and access to Attack and Speed Booster Energy, further bolstered by its superb movepool. Roaring Moon's Dark-type STAB moves and excellent elemental resistances make it a great answer to Iron Crown and Gholdengo, as well as the Ogerpon formes.

  • Roaring Moon appreciates partners such as Ogerpon-W, Amoonguss, and Incineroar, which help it to set up Tailwind or Dragon Dance through free turns, the former two handle threats like Urshifu-R and Flutter Mane exceptionally well. Ogerpon-W greatly benefits from Tailwind, while Amoonguss has superb defensive synergy with Roaring Moon; all partners enjoy Breaking Swipe as well. With Acrobatics, Dragon Dance Roaring Moon can help the former two by removing the powder-immune Grass-types and help Incineroar by threatening both Urshfiu formes. Flutter Mane is also a great beneficiary of Roaring Moon, handling opposing Flutter Mane and both Urshifu formes with Tailwind support, and Breaking Swipe protecting it from the physical attackers it's weak to.

  • Roaring Moon's typing, while welcoming fantastic resistances, also invites weaknesses to some of the metagame's most popular threats like the aforementioned Flutter Mane, both Urshifu formes, and Chien-Pao. Roaring Moon can notably mitigate the latter two's damage output if running Breaking Swipe and break Urshifu-S and Chien-Pao's Focus Sash in the process but requires support against them. Incineroar also poses an issue for Roaring Moon, as it resists Knock Off and weakens Roaring Moon with Intimidate. Incineroar's Fake Out can also be used to stall Tailwind turns.

Dragon Dance Sweeper.description:
• Dragon Dance allows Roaring Moon to be an effective sweeper and helps reset Intimidate Attack drops, making it harder to slow down.

  • Roaring Moon utilizes Attack Booster Energy to activate Acrobatics, allowing for an OHKO on many centralizing Fighting- and Grass-types, such as the various Urshifu and Ogerpon formes, as well as Amoonguss after Terastalization.

  • After Terastalization, the bulk investment allows Roaring Moon to always survive a Tera Water-boosted Surging Strikes from Urshifu-R and a Thunderclap from a Special Attack Booster Energy Raging Bolt. The Speed investment allows Roaring Moon to outspeed Adamant Urshifu formes.

  • Roaring Moon uses Tera Flying to obtain a resistance to Fighting-type moves and to gain STAB on Acrobatics.

Tailwind Support.description:
• Roaring Moon utilizes Breaking Swipe to weaken the metagame's plethora of physical attackers such as the Ogerpon formes and Rillaboom.

  • Roaring Moon uses Speed Booster Energy to outspeed the entire unboosted metagame and get off Tailwind and Breaking Swipe more consistently.

  • The HP combined with the Defense EVs allow for Roaring Moon to take Adamant Chien-Pao's Icicle Crash at -1. The Special Defense EVs allow Roaring Moon to almost always survive unboosted Flutter Mane's Dazzling Gleam, as well as a Dragon Pulse from Raging Bolt. The Speed investment lets Roaring Moon outspeed Speed Booster Energy Iron Crown, as well as Adamant Dragonite under Tailwind,

  • Roaring Moon uses Tera Poison to obtain resistances to Fairy- and Fighting-type moves it was originally weak to, which is also a great neutral typing into the metagame.

Ogerpon.overview:
• Ogerpon is a strong offensive Pokemon that is unique in being able to check many top Pokemon such as Incineroar and Flutter Mane thanks to its ability Defiant and Speed-boosting Embody Aspect after Terastallization. Combined with access to Follow Me and natural immunity to Spore, Ogerpon is capable of being a constant threat while still providing good supportive value.

  • Ogerpon is almost exclusively used on teams built around Dondozo. With its ability Defiant, Ogerpon can be used to punish Incineroar and Gouging Fire, disincentivizing them from weakening both Dondozo and Chien-Pao and even picking up a clean OHKO on Incineroar with Superpower. Once Terastallized, It can outspeed and OHKO Flutter Mane and both Urshifu formes, which are difficult for Dondozo and Chien-pao or Dragonite to handle.

  • Ogerpon struggles against Pokemon that resist Grass STAB as Tornadus and Raging Bolt as well as foes that outspeed it, either forcing Ogerpon to Terastallize or be unable to attack before fainting, such as Chien-Pao, which outspeeds and can survive one hit thanks to it usually holding a Focus Sash. Ogerpon's Grass typing means it's weak to common threats such as Chien-Pao and Gouging Fire, and its middling bulk makes it unable to take more than two attacks most of the time.

Offensive Redirector.description:
• Superpower is used as coverage to hit Steel- and the plethora of Dark-types that resist Ivy Cudgel, such as Kingambit or Chi-yu. Follow Me can be used to redirect attention from the frailer Chien-Pao and Glimmora, making both exponentially harder to deal with, especially so considering Ogerpon resists Urshifu-R Surging Strike's, one of the best counters to Chien-Pao and Glimmora

  • Covert Cloak is used to prevent a flinch from Fake Out, allowing Ogerpon to pressure Incineroar and its partner turn one. Additionally, blocking certain secondary effects such as Icy Wind's Speed drops from opposing Flutter Manes is useful.

  • The Attack investment is necessary to guarantee an OHKO on Incineroar with Superpower, on Flutter Mane once Ogerpon Terastallizes, and to have the highest chance of an OHKO on Urshifu-R. The Speed investment allows Ogerpon to outspeed Choice Scarf Landorus-T after Terastallization. The rest of the EVs are used to round out Ogerpon's bulk.

Ogerpon-Wellspring.overview:
• Ogerpon-W has a very well-rounded stat spread, a solid typing, and an amazing movepool with great STAB moves, Spiky Shield, and Follow Me which helps it support frailer teammates.

  • A great example of a less-bulky teammate is Flutter Mane; Ogerpon-W's ability to redirect moves away from Flutter Mane can help it break through the opposing team with its strong Tera Fairy Dazzling Gleam in just a few turns.

  • Another great partner for Ogerpon-W is Kingambit, as it discourages Intimidate, which is one of the few ways to slow down Ogerpon-W's offensive capabilities, and Kingambit can even run a Swords Dance set to set-up with Follow Me support from Ogerpon-W.

  • Ogerpon-W is also already a big threat on its own, as it pressures top threats such as Landorus, Incineroar, Flutter Mane, and Urshifu-R, being especially dangerous with Tera. Ogerpon-W does struggle against Rillaboom and Raging Bolt, which resist both STAB types and can hit it super effectively after Tera.

Offensive Redirector.description:
• Horn Leech is the Grass-type move of choice, as Ogerpon-W appreciates the extra longevity, which becomes especially notable when combined with the Special Defense boost provided by Terastallizing.

  • The EV spread outspeeds Modest Landorus, OHKOes bulky Flutter Mane after Tera, and survives Rillaboom's terrain-boosted Wood Hammer.

Ogerpon-Hearthflame.overview:
• With a solid stat spread, incredible damage output with Terastallization, a unique typing and access to utility such as Follow Me, Ogerpon-H can provide some unique assets to a team.

  • Ogerpon-H has a strong STAB combination that is only walled by Fire- and Dragon-types. Because of this, some of its best partners include Urshifu-R, Landorus and Flutter Mane, which are all powerful attackers that pair well with Ogerpon-H and enjoy Follow Me support. Another strong partner is Kingambit, which dissuades Intimidate from weakening Ogerpon-H, while Follow Me provides an opportunity for Swords Dance Kingambit to set up.

  • Ogerpon-H becomes an extremely powerful offensive threat once Terastallized, being able to OHKO metagame staples like Flutter Mane, Urshifu-R, Rillaboom, and Landorus. Ogerpon-H also has a fantastic matchup against Amoonguss; not only is it able to completely ignore Amoongus's Spore and Rage Powder, but it is also able to OHKO it with Ivy Cudgel or with Wood Hammer should Amoonguss Terastallize into a Water-type. Additionally, Mystic Water variants of Urshifu-R get outsped and OHKOed.

  • Bad matchups for Ogerpon-H include Pokemon such as Entei and Raging Bolt that can wall its STAB combation. For this reason, as well as Intimidate hampering Ogerpon-H's offensive capabilities, Incineroar is a very stable check to it. Lastly, despite having solid bulk, powerful threats that can outspeed Ogerpon-H can OHKO it such as Choice Scarf Urshifu-R. However, with speed control or Fake Out support from Pokemon like Rillaboom, Ogerpon-H can take on Choice Scarf Urshifu-R.

Offensive.description:
• Horn Leech trades Wood Hammer's power for greater longevity.

  • Follow Me is by far the best third move on this Pokemon, but if the team does not require a redirector, Ogerpon-H can use Grassy Glide; if this is the case, it is almost always paired with Rillaboom to ensure Grassy Glide is a priority move. Alternatively, Stomping Tantrum allows it to hit opposing Fire-types such as Entei and Chi-Yu.

  • The Speed EVs allow Ogerpon-H to outspeed Modest Landorus and Adamant Urshifu-R. The Attack EVs with the Adamant nature allow it to OHKO Flutter Mane after Terastallization even when Ogerpon-H is Intimidated.

  • The bulk investment allows Ogerpon-H to live most Choice Scarf Urshifu-R's Tera Water Surging Strikes while having a favorable roll to survive Timid Landorus's Sludge Bomb.

Ogerpon-Cornerstone.overview:
• Ogerpon-C is a great offensive support Pokemon thanks to its high Attack, good offensive typing, access to Follow Me when paired with its solid defenses and ability, and great Speed, having great matchups into Pokemon like Tornadus and Entei.

  • Ogerpon-C can pair well with offensive Pokemon like Landorus, Choice Scarf Urshifu-R, and Iron Hands that help deal with the Fighting-, Ice-, and Steel-types that threaten it like the Urshifu formes, Chien-Pao, and Archaludon. Ogerpon-C can also support Trick Room setters like Farigiriaf, as they have a much easier time setting Trick Room with Ogerpon-C redirecting moves away from them.

  • Ogerpon-C can be overwhelmed by Pokemon like Gholdengo, Chien-Pao, and especially Urshifu-R, which bypasses its Sturdy ability by using Surging Strikes. Therefore it appreciates partners like Incineroar, Iron Hands, and Amoongus that check these Pokemon. In addition to this, they can also provide it with Fake Out support and redirection.

Redirection Support.description:
• Ivy Cudgel synergizes well with Ogerpon-C's Grass-type moves, hitting Fire- and Flying-types like Tornadus, Incineroar, and Chi-Yu.

  • Horn Leech provides Ogerpon-C with recovery, while Power Whip hits targets harder, threatening an OHKO on Urshifu-R.

  • Follow Me lets it redirect moves away from its teammates like Sucker Punch and Spore from Chien-Pao and Amoonguss, respectively.

  • Tera Rock bolsters Ivy Cudgel's damage, letting it guarantee an OHKO on Entei, and the Defense boost thanks to Embody Aspect can let it almost always survive Close Combat from Choice Scarf Urshifu-R.

Archaludon.overview:
• Archaludon can utilize its above-average bulk, solid Special Attack stat, and great Ability in Stamina to check and OHKO threats such as Urshifu-R, Incineroar, and Raging Bolt.

  • Archaludon's access to Stamina and Body Press combined with its resistances and great physical bulk make it an amazing check to Pokemon such as Rillaboom and the Ogerpon formes and also allow it to act as a wincon.

  • Archaludon appreciates teammates like Amoonguss and Sinistcha that provide it with recovery through Pollen Puff and Hospitality, as well as Rage Powder for redirection. Rillaboom provides Fake Out support, as well as passive healing through Grassy Terrain and priority with Grassy Glide that discourages the opponent from leading with Urshifu-R. Dual screens from Grimmsnarl and damage reduction from Incineroar's Intimidate or Snarl are also useful for keeping Archaludon alive to stack Stamina or Electro Shot stat increases.

  • Archaludon fits well on rain teams thanks to its Grass and Electric resistances. It appreciates teammates such as Pelipper that can check opposing Ground- and Fighting-types like Landorus and both Urshifu formes; Pelipper's rain support also allows Electro Shot to charge in one turn, OHKOing Urshifu-R and Tornadus. Archaludon also functions well on Trick Room teams due to many of its checks being faster than it, such as both Urshifu formes, Landorus, and Chien-Pao running Sacred Sword. Farigiraf pairs notably well with Archaludon on Trick Room teams due to the protection from priority it provides and its access to Psychic Noise, which disables Iron Hands's Drain Punch.

Rain Sweeper.description:
• Archaludon's Defense EVs allow it to survive Adamant Choice Scarf Urshifu-R's and Urshifu-S's Close Combat, meaning it can take a hit, boost itself with Electro Shot, and OHKO Urshifu-R on the same turn, provided rain is currently active. The Special Defense investment prevents it from being 2HKOed by Special Attack Booster Energy Flutter Mane's Moonblast.

  • Archaludon does not particularly require Special Attack investment thanks to Electro Shot boosting this stat, but 36 Special Attack EVs with a Modest nature give Archaludon an extra point in Special Attack because of how stat calculation works.

  • 28 Speed EVs are to outspeed Choice Scarf Urshifu-R, Urshifu-S and Landorus-T when Archaludon is under Tailwind.

  • Draco Meteor and Electro Shot OHKO Pokemon such as Raging Bolt, Urshifu-R, and Tornadus. Flash Cannon OHKOes Flutter Mane after one Electro Shot boost, and Body Press is good to threaten an OHKO on Chien-Pao, and significant damage on Incineroar, especially after a Stamina boost.

  • Tera Grass gives Archaludon a resistance to Ground-type moves such as Landorus's Sandsear Storm and Earth Power, and immunity to Spore and Rage Powder. Meanwhile, Tera Fairy gives it a Fighting resistance and Dragon immunity to beat Urshifu and opposing Dragon-types respectively.

Gouging Fire.overview:
• Gouging Fire is a solid offensive support Pokemon with a good defensive typing. Breaking Swipe and Burning Bulwark give it a great matchup against physical attackers such as Rillaboom and Chien-Pao.

  • Kingambit is one of the most prominent partners for Gouging Fire, because it prevents Incineroar from crippling Gouging Fire with Intimidate. Ogerpon-W fits well with Gouging Fire as well, as with Follow Me it can protect Gouging Fire from Ground- and Water-type moves, both of which Ogerpon-W resists.

  • The Urshifu formes counter Gouging Fire, since they ignore Burning Bulwark and Breaking Swipe. Incineroar is also a good counter to Gouging Fire, cycling Intimidate and Parting Shot repeatedly until Gouging Fire is a sitting duck. Gouging Fire also struggles against special attackers like Flutter Mane and Landorus, which can hit it for big damage, the latter threatening it for an OHKO.

Offensive Support.description:
• Heat Crash is a reliable way of dealing damage, and because Gouging Fire is so heavy, it will almost always do good damage against most of the metagame. Howl can be used to take advantage of passive playstyles and partially negate Intimidate, and with a Speed Booster Energy, it can support the Kingambit and Ogerpon-W in return.

  • 252 HP and 20 Defense EVs allow you to always live two Wicked Blows from Adamant Urshifu-S, and 164 Speed EVs with a Jolly Nature allow you to and outspeed Adamant Choice Scarf Landorus-T and Chien-Pao once the Booster Energy has been consumed.

  • Tera Grass is a good defensive Tera type for Gouging Fire, as it lets Gouging Fire resist Ground-type moves like Landorus's Earth Power and makes it immune to Spore, which is crucial since Burning Bulwark doesn't Protect Gouging Fire from status moves. Tera Fairy is also a good option as well, as it lets Gouging Fire resist both of Urshifu-S's STAB moves and take neutral damage from the majority of the metagame.

Raging Bolt.overview:
• Raging Bolt, with a higher Special Attack than Flutter Mane, massive HP, and good defenses, serves its role as a bulky damage dealer exceptionally well.

  • Don't let Raging Bolt's middling Speed fool you; its signature move, Thunderclap, prevents it from being an issue in a lot of situations and makes the Tornadus + Urshifu-R matchup virtually trivial. Raging Bolt is also really strong into the Ogerpon formes and Rillaboom, as it resists all of their STAB moves except Ogerpon-C's, unless the Ogerpon-H and Rillaboom are carrying Stomping Tantrum and High Horsepower as coverage, respectively.

  • Raging Bolt pairs insanely well with Rillaboom and Incineroar, as they provide Fake Out pressure for Raging Bolt to take advantage of by lowering the foe's Special Attack or Speed on the Assault Vest set, set up with the Calm Mind set or deal massive damage with the three attacks set. Rillaboom also provides more longevity in Grassy Terrain for Raging Bolt, which can make it immensely difficult to KO. Chien-Pao and Choice Scarf Urshifu-R are also excellent partners thanks to dealing with Raging Bolt's worst matchup, Landorus.

  • That said, Raging Bolt does still have bad matchups, one of which is the aforementioned Landorus due to it being able to threaten an OHKO against Raging Bolt with Earth Power. Chien-Pao can also be a tricky matchup, as it can deal massive damage with its Ice-type STAB move and cause mindgames with Sucker Punch. Flutter Mane is able to deal huge damage to Raging Bolt even when it Terastallizes and can very comfortably take unboosted Thunderclaps.

Assault Vest.description:
• Electroweb is sometimes run over Thunderbolt for speed control. Volt Switch allows for Raging Bolt to become a bulky pivot and pairs well with Draco Meteor, allowing it to switch out after the Special Attack drop. Snarl weakens opposing special attackers, enabling it to sit on the field for longer and deal damage. Tera Blast gives Raging Bolt a strong option into bulky Dark-types and Fighting-types like Ting-Lu and Iron Hands.

  • Assault Vest allows Raging Bolt to fully take advantage of its amazing bulk, letting it sit on the field and tank hit after hit all while dealing respectable damage and disrupting the foe with moves like Snarl and Electroweb.

  • The defensive investment allows Raging Bolt to always survive Icicle Crash from Adamant Chien-Pao and Moonblast from Choice Specs Flutter Mane. The Speed investment allows Raging Bolt to outspeed Glimmora and Modest Chi-Yu after an Electroweb. The rest of the EVs were put into offensive investment.

  • Tera Fairy is just an incredibly strong neutral Tera type, especially for a Pokemon with as much bulk as Raging Bolt has, and provides a resistance to Urshifu-S's STAB moves.

Calm Mind.description:
• Thunderclap is a good main STAB move, as it allows Raging Bolt to focus less on Speed and go all out on bulk investment, as it will be able to boost up then hit most foes before they can retaliate.

  • While Dragon Pulse is usually an underwhelming move, it serves as a strong neutral STAB move into Pokemon that resist Electric-type attacks when paired with Calm Mind.

  • In some situations, Thunderbolt can be used over Protect, due to Raging Bolt being bulky enough to where Protect isn't mandatory on Calm Mind sets, and for consistency against support Pokmon such as Follow Me Ogerpon-W where Thunderclap would fail.

  • Leftovers is preferred on the Calm Mind set, providing immense longevity with Grassy Terrain from Rillaboom.

  • The Defense EVs with the HP EVs allow Raging Bolt to live Icicle Crash from Adamant Chien-Pao. The HP EVs make the HP optimized for Leftovers and Grassy Terrain recovery. The bulk investment ensures that Raging Bolt is able to tank 2 unboosted Moonblasts from Timid Flutter Mane at +1 Special Defense after Leftovers and Grassy Terrain recovery combined with Protect. The Special Defense EVs hit an even number to be optimal for the Calm Mind boost.

  • Raging Bolt utilizes Tera Fairy for the resistance to Urshifu-S's STAB moves and neutral matchup against the majority of the metagame.

3 Attacks.description:
• Thunderbolt provides good consistent damage, especially with Tera Electric, while Thunderclap helps make up for Raging Bolt's middling Speed. Draco Meteor is a more powerful option, being able to OHKO Pokmon like Landorus when used with Booster Energy. However, it can be forced to switch out after a Special Attack drop and lose the boost.

  • Booster Energy is a strong option, as boosting Raging Bolt's already huge base Special Attack even further turns it into an absolute nuke. Safety Goggles prevents Amoonguss from redirecting Thunderclaps away from Urshifu-R.

  • The Speed investment allows Raging Bolt to outspeed Dragapult, Flutter Mane, and Chien-Pao while under Tailwind, allowing it to hit them with its stronger options like Thunderbolt and Draco Meteor.

  • Tera Grass is a good option to not only resist Ground-type moves from Landorus but also ignore Amoonguss's Spore and redirection with Rage Powder without running Safety Goggles. Tera Electric will often be a consistent option for just raw damage output.

Iron Crown.overview:
• Iron Crown is an excellent choice for offensive teams looking to take advantage of the powerful move Expanding Force thanks to its well-rounded stats and access to Booster Energy. It performs best against frailer offensive teams consisting of Pokemon that do not resist Expanding Force, such as Tornadus, Landorus, and Urshifu-R.

  • Although it can be used as a sweeper early-game to soften opposing teams, it is usually better to save Iron Crown for the late-game when its checks have been sufficiently weakened for it to sweep.

  • Indeedee-F is by far Iron Crown's best teammate, offering role compression as a Psychic Terrain setter and redirector. Access to Helping Hand also further amplifies its partner's ridiculous damage output.

  • Iron Crown's best counters are Dark- and Steel-types, namely Incineroar, Kingambit, Archaludon, and Gholdengo, all of which resist both of Iron Crown's STAB moves.

  • Therefore, Iron Crown appreciates Pokemon that can help remove these threats consistently, such as Landorus, Entei, and Urshifu-R. In return, Iron Crown can pressure opposing Urshifu-R and Amoonguss.

  • Rillaboom is another noteworthy check, as it is able to safely pivot in and override Psychic Terrain, weakening Expanding Force significantly. Other Pokemon with access to Ice Spinner like Chien-Pao and Dragonite can also be used to remove Psychic Terrain.

  • Faster Pokemon like Chien-Pao and Flutter Mane serve as good checks as well, but they have to watch out for Follow Me from Indeedee-F as they are vulnerable to Tachyon Cutter.

Booster Energy.description:
• Expanding Force is Iron Crown's go-to STAB move, allowing it to devastate foes under Psychic Terrain.

  • Tachyon Cutter helps secure the OHKO on Pokemon like Chien-Pao and Whimsicott, which commonly hold Focus Sash.

  • Tera Water is a naturally good defensive typing that, when coupled with Tera Blast, gives Iron Crown an out against the aforementioned Dark- and Steel-type Pokemon, which otherwise counter it. Focus Blast can be used over Tera Blast to secure the OHKO on Kingambit, but is rather inconsistent and is unable to hit Gholdengo.

  • An alternative spread of 76 HP / 4 Def / 172 SpA / 4 SpD / 252 Spe allows Iron Crown to outspeed Flutter Mane and Chien-Pao thanks to Speed Booster Energy.

  • This set can also be run with a Modest nature to maximize Iron Crown's damage output, at the risk of underspeeding opposing Pokemon in the same Speed tier such as Modest Landorus and both Urshifu formes.
